author: danjmartin
title: danjmartin published Prime minister David Cameron announces he will quit in wake of...
text:
Prime minister David Cameron announces he will quit in wake of Brexit defeat By danjmartin | Posted: June 24, 2016 1 COMMENTS SHARES Prime minister David Cameron announces he will quit in wake of Brexit defeat X 
Copy link to paste in your message / Comments (1) 
David Cameron will step down as Prime Minister after Britain's Brexit vote. 
An emotional Mr Cameron has appeared outside 10 Downing Street to admit he is no longer the 'captain to steer the ship'.His decision will bring to an end his six years leading the Government. 
He fought for the Country to Remain in the European Union while saying his successor should be in place by October to start the negotiations for the country's withdrawal. 
Flanked by wife Samantha, Mr Cameron said he had informed the Queen of his decision to remain in place for the short term, but hand over to a new Prime Minister by the time of the Conservative annual conference. 
"The British people have voted to leave the European Union and their will must be respected," said Mr Cameron. 
"The will of the British people is an instruction that must be delivered." 
His voice breaking, Mr Cameron said: "I love this country and I feel honoured to have served it and I will do everything I can in future to help this great country succeed." 
Pro-Brexit Tory North West Leicestershire MP Andrew Bridgen, a long-time critic of Mr Cameron's, said: "I know he wanted to the right thing. 
"I have particular respect for his decision and this handover period is exactly what is needed. 
"Politics is a risky game. 
"The Prime Minister and I have never been bosom buddies but I have nothing but admiration for the way he is now acting." 
Mr Cameron did not indicate who might succeed him but Boris Johnson is a leading contender.
